question: [File: aptos-core/storage/backup/backup-cli/src/utils/stream/try_buffered_x.rs] [Struct: TryBufferedX] [Buffer growth] If max is set much larger than max_in_progress in FuturesOrderedX, can this create a memory imbalance where queued futures consume unbounded memory? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/storage/backup/backup-cli/src/utils/stream/try_buffered_x.rs] [Function: new()] [Parameter validation] Are n and max_in_progress validated to ensure n >= max_in_progress, or can invalid configurations cause deadlocks where futures never progress? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/storage/backup/backup-cli/src/utils/stream/try_buffered_x.rs] [Struct: TryBufferedX] [Drop handler] Does TryBufferedX properly implement Drop to cancel in-flight futures and release resources, or can unclean shutdown during backup leave corrupted state? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/storage/backup/backup-cli/src/utils/stream/try_buffered_x.rs] [Trait bound: St::Ok: TryFuture] [Error type mismatch] At line 50, if St::Error differs from <St::Ok as TryFuture>::Error despite the bound, can error propagation cause type confusion and silent failures? (High)

[File: aptos-core/storage/backup/backup-cli/src/utils/stream/try_buffered_x.rs] [Struct: TryBufferedX] [Concurrency limit bypass] Can the max_in_progress limit in FuturesOrderedX be bypassed by pushing futures faster than they complete, causing resource exhaustion during backup restoration? (High)

[File: aptos-core/storage/backup/backup-cli/src/utils/stream/try_buffered_x.rs] [Function: poll_next()] [Queue synchronization] When in_progress_queue.len() is checked at line 59, can the underlying FuturesOrderedX's length change between check and use, causing race conditions? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/storage/backup/backup-cli/src/utils/stream/try_buffered_x.rs] [Function: poll_next()] [Ordering violation] If FuturesOrderedX's BinaryHeap reordering has bugs, can backup chunks be processed out of sequence, corrupting the restored ledger state? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/storage/backup/backup-cli/src/utils/stream/try_buffered_x.rs] [Function: poll_next()] [Index overflow] Can the next_incoming_index in FuturesOrderedX overflow after processing many backup chunks, causing ordering to wrap around and futures to be processed in wrong order? (High)

[File: aptos-core/storage/backup/backup-cli/src/utils/stream/try_buffered_x.rs] [Usage context] [Chunk corruption] During transaction backup restoration, can a malicious backup file cause TryBufferedX to process corrupted chunks out of order, leading to invalid merkle tree states? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/storage/backup/backup-cli/src/utils/stream/try_buffered_x.rs] [Usage context] [Partial restoration] If backup restoration is interrupted while TryBufferedX has futures in progress, can this leave the database in a partially restored state with inconsistent version numbers? [File: aptos-core/storage/backup/backup-cli/src/utils/stream/try_buffered_x.rs] [Usage context] [Replay attack] Can an attacker replay old backup chunks through TryBufferedX to rollback validator state to a previous version, causing chain forks? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/storage/backup/backup-cli/src/utils/stream/try_buffered_x.rs] [Usage context] [Version skipping] If backup chunks are processed concurrently via TryBufferedX, can missing or skipped version numbers go undetected, corrupting the transaction history? (High)

[File: aptos-core/storage/backup/backup-cli/src/utils/stream/try_buffered_x.rs] [Usage context] [State snapshot attack] During state snapshot backup processing, can TryBufferedX's concurrent execution cause inconsistent reads across different state items, violating snapshot isolation? (High)
